meanings.definition: The quality of being applicable to a wide range of situations or cases.
meanings.sent1: The generalizability of the research findings allows us to apply them to various scenarios.
meanings.sent2: Researchers aim to achieve high generalizability in their studies to make their conclusions relevant to many different cases.
meanings.sent3: The generalizability of the cooking recipe was put to the test when it was used to bake a cake instead of cookies.
meanings.sent4: Her theory on friendship had such broad generalizability that it could be applied to any type of relationship.
meanings.sent5: The generalizability of the safety guidelines made them easy to follow in any workplace setting.

meanings.definition: The extent to which findings from a study can be applied to a larger population.
meanings.sent1: The generalizability of the survey results was crucial in determining public opinion.
meanings.sent2: When discussing the generalizability of the study, we must consider the diversity of the population.
meanings.sent3: The generalizability of the weather forecast to predict the behavior of squirrels was quite amusing.
meanings.sent4: The generalizability of the study's conclusions to society as a whole was truly remarkable.
meanings.sent5: The generalizability of the new teaching method made it effective for students of all ages.
